greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of Dyck paths of semilength n with exactly k (possibly overlapping) occurrences of some of the consecutive patterns of Dyck paths of semilength 3; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=max(0,n-2), read by rows.
comment: The consecutive patterns 101010, 101100, 110010, 110100, 111000 are counted.  Here 1=Up=(1,1), 0=Down=(1,-1).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..142, flattened
maple: b:= proc(x, y, t) option remember; `if`(y<0 or y>x, 0,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, z, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(2*n, 0, 0)):
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 17 2014
